item.title: George add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: George add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Eighty percent of success is showing up." -- Woody Allen

item.title: George add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "I swear by my life and my love of it that I will never live for the sake of another man, nor ask another man to live for mine." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: George add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "There ain't no such thing as a free lunch." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: George add a quote by Frank Lloyd Wright
item.description: "Early in my career...I had to choose between an honest arrogance and a hypercritical humility... I deliberately choose an honest arrogance, and I've never been sorry." -- Frank Lloyd Wright

item.title: George add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: George add a quote by R. A. Scotti
item.description: "Impatience makes fools of clever men..." -- R. A. Scotti

item.title: George add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: George add a quote by Michael Chabon
item.description: "The handy thing about being a father is that the historic standard is so pitifully low." -- Michael Chabon

item.title: George add a quote by Peter Ackroyd
item.description: "Bigotry does not consort easily with free trade." -- Peter Ackroyd

item.title: George add a quote by William Graham Sumner
item.description: "There is no device whatever to be invented for securing happiness without industry, economy, and virtue." -- William Graham Sumner

item.title: George add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: George add a quote by Joanne Harris
item.description: "I believe that being happy is the only important thing. Happiness. Simple as a glass of chocolate or torturous as the heart. Bitter. Sweet. Alive." -- Joanne Harris

item.title: George add a quote by Bob Moawad
item.description: "You can't make footprints in the sands of time if you're sitting on your butt. And who wants to make buttprints in the sands of time?" -- Bob Moawad

item.title: George add a quote by Scott Hamilton
item.description: "The only disability in life is a bad attitude." -- Scott Hamilton

item.title: George add a quote by Philippe Petit
item.description: "The rest is usually just an inhuman amount of tenacious work." -- Philippe Petit

item.title: George add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "There is no duty we so much underrate as the duty of being happy. By being happy we sow anonymous benefits upon the world." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: George add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: George add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means..." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: George add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: George add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description: "Do not go gentle into that good night. Rage, rage against the dying of the light." -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: George add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "No medicine cures what happiness cannot." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: George add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Never tell the truth to people who are not worthy of it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: George add a quote by Eleanor Hodgman Porter
item.description: "Be glad. Be good. Be brave." -- Eleanor Hodgman Porter

item.title: George add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "The surest defense against Evil is extreme individualism, originality of thinking, whimsicality, even—if you will—eccentricity." -- Joseph Brodsky
